item.title: Client help
item.dc:creator: @Motaro Motaro
item.description:
@Motaro wrote:

I tried something like this and I think I know the fix.

Something like

public boolean drawTextBox = false;

And then like under drawWindowMenus() I think…

else if(drawTextBox) showTextBox();

Then just like do whatever you want to make drawTextBox true.

Read full topic

item.title: Client help
item.dc:creator: @dimebagx dimebagx
item.description:
@dimebagx wrote:

public void showTestBox() { gameGraphics.drawBox(86, 77, 340, 180, 0); gameGraphics.drawBoxEdge(86, 77, 340, 180, 0xffffff); System.out.println("test"); }

This is a function in my client, that is called by the server via command,
it’s supposed to create a box, the packet reaches it as it outputs “test” ,
but the box isn’t drawn,

Can someone explain what im doing wrong, is there some sort of screen refresh method that needs to be called?

Read full topic
